definitions.definition: An act of retracting or withdrawing (a mistake , a statement , etc.); a retraction .
A pulling back , especially ( military ) of an army or military troops ; a pull-back , a retreat ; also, a signal for this to be done.

A subgroup of a given group such that there is a surjective endomorphism from the ambient group to the subgroup which is constant on the subgroup; in this case the subgroup is a retract of the ambient group . In symbols: H {\displaystyle H} in G {\displaystyle G} is a retract of G {\displaystyle G} if there exists a surjective homomorphism σ {\displaystyle \sigma } from G {\displaystyle G} to H {\displaystyle H} with σ | H = id {\displaystyle \sigma |_{H}=\operatorname {id} } .
Synonym of retreat ( “ an act of accidentally injuring a horse 's foot by incorrectly nailing it during shoeing ” ) .

main_definition: An act of retracting or withdrawing (a mistake , a statement , etc.); a retraction .
secondary_definitions: A pulling back , especially ( military ) of an army or military troops ; a pull-back , a retreat ; also, a signal for this to be done.

( group theory ) A subgroup of a given group such that there is a surjective endomorphism from the ambient group to the subgroup which is constant on the subgroup; in this case the subgroup is a retract of the ambient group . In symbols: H {\displaystyle H} in G {\displaystyle G} is a retract of G {\displaystyle G} if there exists a surjective homomorphism σ {\displaystyle \sigma } from G {\displaystyle G} to H {\displaystyle H} with σ | H = id {\displaystyle \sigma |_{H}=\operatorname {id} } .
( topology ) The target of a retraction .
Synonym of retreat ( “ an act of accidentally injuring a horse 's foot by incorrectly nailing it during shoeing ” ) .
